channel.title: [317-508]LandScape Editor?
channel.description:
Is this possible?? I've known now for a while that it is possible with RSC Servers but what about the newer servers? I figure it has something to do with the client files and their cache. This would be a great tool for adding things you wanted Example. Custom city without having to spawn global objects taking up space in your server files. Move a few houses to another place. Make edgevill covered in snow without having to do the whole annoying thing with hard coding the clients.
This is just an Idea we should work on. Who Supports?
IF JAGEX CAN DO IT WHY CAN'T WE??!
Moderators please don't lock this.
Re-Posted from another section. (It belongs here)

item.title: [317-508]LandScape Editor?
item.dc:creator: @bryanc Bryanc
item.description:
@bryanc wrote:

Anything is possible… I mean the map data is being drawn by the client, so just find the methods it uses in whole and then implement it into an editor.

item.title: [317-508]LandScape Editor?
item.dc:creator: @P_I_M_P_3_D_Tut `Lewk_
item.description:
@P_I_M_P_3_D_Tut wrote:

[quote=“Who Tank, post:4, topic:251061”]Yeah, I guess, But mapdata is pretty complex, and requires quite a bit of skill. Oh, what do I know (;[/quote] Yes. What do you know?
like he said. Mapdata is complex, Unless you can make a program reading it I dont think you’ll be able to do it, Even if you do, I dont think you would know how to replace it.
Lawl,
good luck. Theres really no point in asking this. Imo.

Read full topic
